definition: canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn

sentences.english: The "Tong Dian" of Du you is a historic cultural establishments system political book.
sentences.chinese: 杜佑《通典》是一部历史性典章制度政书。

sentences.english: the assembly must judge between him and the avenger of blood according to these regulations.
sentences.chinese: 会众就要照典章，在打死人的和报血仇的中间审判。

sentences.english: I remember your ancient laws, O Lord , and I find comfort in them.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华阿，我记念你从古以来的典章，就得了安慰。

sentences.english: I have not departed from thy judgments: for thou hast taught me.
sentences.chinese: 我没有偏离你的典章，因为你教训了我。

sentences.english: I have not departed from your laws, for you yourself have taught me.
sentences.chinese: 我没有偏离你的典章，因为你教训了我。

sentences.english: I have taken an oath and confirmed it, that I will follow your righteous laws.
sentences.chinese: 你公义的典章，我曾起誓遵守，我必按誓而行。

sentences.english: Anyone who touch the sanctified vessels of God in defilement are profaning the name of God.
sentences.chinese: 当人故意违背神的律例，典章，就是亵渎神的名。

sentences.english: Political books, history books recorded in various institutions.
sentences.chinese: 政书，记载典章制度的史籍。

sentences.english: I have sworn, and I will perform [it], that I will keep thy righteous judgments.
sentences.chinese: 你公义的典章，我曾起誓遵守，我必按誓而行。

sentences.english: And here in this portion, the Word of God is called the "righteous ordinances".
sentences.chinese: 而在这段中，神的话被称为“公义的典章”。

sentences.english: With my lips I recount all the laws that come from your mouth.
sentences.chinese: 我用嘴唇传扬你口中的一切典章。

sentences.english: Then the congregation shall judge between the slayer and the revenger of blood according to these judgments
sentences.chinese: 会众就要照典章，在打死人的和报血仇的中间审判。

sentences.english: You must obey my laws and be careful to follow my decrees.
sentences.chinese: 你们要遵我的典章，守我的律例，按此而行。

sentences.english: But you must keep my decrees and my laws.
sentences.chinese: 故此你们要守我的律例，典章。

sentences.english: I remembered thy judgments of old, O LORD; and have comforted myself.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华阿，我记念你从古以来的典章，就得了安慰。

sentences.english: When people purposely violate God's laws and decrees, they are profaning the name of God.
sentences.chinese: 当人故意违背神的律例，典章，就是亵渎神的名。

definition: Rites and Ceremonies, part of the Confucian Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4]
(Confucianism) rites and music (the means of regulating society)

pair of annual sacrificial ceremonies held by the emperor in ancient times: one in the southern suburbs of the capital (bringing offerings to Heaven) and another in the northern suburbs (with offerings to Earth)
